@graph.title: Efficiency, equity, and legitimacy : the multilateral trading system at the millennium
abstract: Preface -- Raymond Vernon / Roger B. Porter -- PART ONE, Introduction and Overview. 1. Efficiency, equity, and legitimacy : the global trading system in the twenty-first century / Roger B. Porter -- 2. Dark clouds over Geneva? : the troubled prospects of the multilateral trading system / Pierre Sauv(c)♭ and Arvind Subramanian -- 3. A rough map of challenges to the multilateral trading system at the millennium / Americo Beviglia Zampetti -- 4. After Seattle : free trade and the WTO / Jagdish Bhagwati -- 5. A new framework for globalization / Jeffrey D. Sachs. -- PART TWO, Efficiency. 6. Assessing the efficiency gains from further liberalization / Jeffrey A. Frankel -- 7. "Efficient protection" through WTO rulemaking / Alan O. Sykes -- Part Two summary / F.M. Scherer

PART THREE, Equity. 8. Market access for developing countries / Alan V. Deardorff -- 9. Who's afraid of globalization? : domestic adjustment in Europe and America / Andr(c)♭ Sapir -- 10. Fostering equity through international institutions / David Dollar -- Part Three summary / Debora Spar -- PART FOUR, Legitimacy. 11. Legitimacy and global governance : why constitutionalizing the WTO is a step too far / Robert Howse and Kalypso Nicola(c)Ådis -- 12. The club model of multilateral cooperation and problems of democratic legitimacy / Robert O. Keohane and Joseph S. Nye Jr. -- 13. Are judicial organs of the World Trade Organization overburdened? / Frieder Roessler -- 14. The rule of lawyers and the ethos of diplomats : reflections on WTO dispute settlement / J.H.H. Weiler -- Part Four summary / Joel P. Trachtman -- PART 5, Governance. 15. World Trade Organization : institutional design for better governance / Sylvia Ostry -- 16. Governance of the global trading system / Robert D. Hormats -- Part Five summary / Gary C. Hufbauer -- General summary / Jonathan T. Fried
@graph.creator: gnd:672663-X
